messages.title: The choice for Ilkley
messages.content: There can only be two outcomes from this General Election: A Labour government or a Conservative government.

messages.title: Securing economic recovery
messages.content: A Labour government would continue to support workers and businesses, strengthening the economy and avoiding making a 'bad situation' handle the deficit 'worse'.

messages.title: A future fair for all.
messages.content: Labour will stand up for families and policing. Labour's 'Child Tax Credits' will families up to £225 a year, and will help to start a Child Trust Fund.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will safeguard the NHS, invest in it, value it, and provide new guarantees for patients, including a one week cancer diagnosis guarantee.
Labour will respond to antisocial behaviour within 24 hours. Support neighbourhood policing with new guarantees on response times.
Labour's Australian-style points-based system checks who comes to the country. Labour will ensure that employers advertise jobs locally first.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The Conservative Council, Eric Pickles, Dodgy Dave

issues.economy: Labour government would work to support workers and businesses.
issues.education: Must protect sure start centres, must promote schooling that works for every child.
issues.health: Labour will safeguard the NHS, invest in it, value it, and provide new guarantees for patients, including a one week cancer diagnosis guarantee.
issues.immigration: Labour's Australian-style points-based system checks who comes to the country.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour will stand up for families.

housing.content: Labour has announced a half billion pounds of support for homeowners to refit with Insulation, double glazing, and roofs, helping them to save money and help the environment. Labour supports building of affordable housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: Ilkley residents, here’s just a heads-up from the fallows of Ilkley Tarn and Bradford Council H.Q. My name is Andrew Dundas...

contactInformation.address: The Labour Party, 35 Devonshire Street, BD21 2BH

images.caption: Andrew Dundas - A strong new voice for Ilkley
